column4: I have nothing downloading. But something is taking all my harddrive space really fast (you can watch it sinking lower and lower by the second) Can anyone help me find out what it is?
logs? look in /var/log.. or use the disk usage analyzer
which sort of logs should I be looking at there?
anything growing..
it's the only think I know of that just keeps increasing in size
my logs and system files are on a separate partition
which partition is slowly growing out of free space then?
/home and not slowly either, way faster than my internet
hmm.. any special folder? use the disk usage analyzer and tell it to scan your home folder
ok I've got a 5.4gb .xsession-errors  It would grow bigger but the drive is now full
hmm.. something wrong then... are those files just the same line over and over?
still trying to load it and find out
perhaps just checking the syslog might do it (tail /var/log/syslog)
not much activity there
hmm.. odd.. try it on the big xsession error file then
got lots of these: QObject: 17 timers now exist for object QObject::unnamed
tried googling for that.. almost no hits..
try shutting stuff down.. see if you can find whatever is causing this.. or see if it's using a lot cpu time.. (use top or something)
already tried that and nothing is sticking out
rebooting to see if that fixes it
after I deleted the file and a reboot it all works now
hmm.. well.. guess we'll never know what went wrong in the first place.. nice to hear it fixed itself though =)
